Welcome to Xubuntu 13.10, codenamed Saucy Salamander.

== Getting Xubuntu 13.10 ==

=== Download a Disk Image ===
'''<nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/xubuntu/releases/saucy/release/|Bootable images for standard PCs/laptops/netbooks]]</nowiki>'''

Instructions for burning the image to a DVD or USB flash drive can be found on the <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto|Burning ISO Howto]]</nowiki>.

We recommend you learn how to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HowToMD5SUM|check your image file]]</nowiki> so your pre-release is as itâ€™s supposed to be. Compare your MD5 checksum with the correct ones found <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/xubuntu/releases/saucy/release/MD5SUMS|alongside the images]]</nowiki>.

== Xubuntu 13.10 Highlights ==

=== New software versions ===

* A new version of xfce4-settings has been uploaded bringing amongst other things a new dialog to set up your displays
* A tool for changing your theme colors easily, gtk-theme-config, has been added to the default installation

=== Xubuntu Desktop ===
* New wallpaper
* New releases of our Gtk themes (with Gtk3.10 support) as well as the LightDM greeter, fixing many visual bugs
* Updated documentation

== Known Problems ==
* indicator-sound no longer functions with xfce4-indicator-plugin (Bug:1208204)
* Gmusicbrowser's albuminfo-plugin is deactivated by default and causes the app to hang if enabled (Bug:1223808)
* Restart button fails to work in Update Manager (Bug:1232363)
* User Administration - a new User is added correctly, but Administration app crashes on close (Bug:1185396)
* Lock screen slow to appear on resume from suspend (Bug:1229486)

More general known issues not specific to Xubuntu can be found at the <nowiki>[[SaucySalamander-ReleaseNotes#Known_issues|Ubuntu release notes]]</nowiki>.
